triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: The paper addresses formation control problems for multiagent systems with dynamic uncertainties and limited communication.

triples.name: Backstepping
triples.relevance: Backstepping method is used as the framework for the controller design in this work.

triples.name: Neural network (machine learning)
triples.relevance: Neural networks are employed for composite dynamic surface control to achieve better approximating performance.

triples.name: Lyapunov stability
triples.relevance: Lyapunov stability theory is used to prove that all signals in the closed-loop system are semi-globally uniformly ultimately bounded.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: Control theory provides the theoretical foundation for designing the formation control system.

triples.name: Nonlinear control
triples.relevance: The paper addresses nonlinear multiagent systems using nonlinear control techniques like backstepping and adaptive methods.

triples.name: Sliding mode control
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel dynamic surface control strategy similar in concept to sliding mode control for achieving prescribed performance in nonlinear systems.

triples.name: Adaptive control
triples.relevance: The paper proposes adaptive neural network-based control with disturbance observers to handle dynamic uncertainties in multiagent systems.
